comment.body:
I propose:
```
eshlomo.us#$?#style[type^="text/css"] { remove: true; }
||eshlomo.us^$inline-script
```
I know the AdGuard team doesn't seem to like `$inline-script` very much, but I couldn't get anything else to work after some 30min of testing.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Sorry, I made a mistake.
The exact URL is like this:
https://m.cafe.naver.com/ca-fe/home/feed

The feed section, named "새글피드" in Korean, will show something only if you sign up on Naver cafe and then join some cafes in it.

There could be a syntax error in the rule I wrote, for I'm a fresh user.

I just picked the ad element using uBlock Origin's [element picker mode] in desktop Firefox, and then edited the rule with my limited knowledge on adguard.
The original rule created on UBO when I picked the ad is this:
m.cafe.naver.com##.adtype_feed
which means "adtype_feed" class under m.cafe.naver.com domain.

I am using AdGuard app on iOS and have enabled it as Safari extension, so the ad doesn't show up when I see the feed page on Safari. But it 'does' except on Safari.
I'd also like to block the ad on Firefox or Naver cafe app on iOS, using AdGuard DNS.
I know Safari extension doesn't work on Firefox.
Thus, I hope you add some rule to your DNS system to block the above ad, as a lot of ads are being blocked by your DNS.

Thank you.
Let me know if you need additional info.

![1BE4DAD4-E6A1-4978-962A-5C1A266EFADF](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10944671/183291922-32b6db97-14ed-46b4-a553-80ea6305c3bc.png)

comment.body:
@piquark6046

> Please install this: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/adguard-adblocker/

I meant I'd like to block the ad on 'other platforms such as Firefox or standalone app on iOS, not on Safari'
(I know how-to on Safari; I'd been already using AdGuard on iOS and had made a 'Safari user rule' to block it on iOS AdGuard, but it doesn't work on 'other platforms.')

Anyway, I just installed AdGuard Adblock on Firefox on Windows.

I reloaded the Naver feed webpage, and did these in order:
1) clicked [Block ads on this website] on AdGuard add-on panel on Firefox
2) clicked [Start] button on Element Blocking layer
3) clicked the ad section
After that, User rule is created like this:

m.cafe.naver.com###ct > div.list_section.feed_section:nth-child(2) > ul.list_feed:first-child > li.adtype_feed:nth-child(3)

This rule perfectly removes the ad layer.
I'd like this also works on 'Firefox on iOS', by using AdGuard 'DNS', because AdGuard doesn't work on Firefox on iOS.
Thus, I'm asking you to add this rule to your DNS system.

> I need some network history.

Sorry, I didn't get it well. I'm just a fresh and ordinary user, not an expert.
